doc.p: This section contains information to help you troubleshoot the apps you develop with Couchbase Lite.
doc.h2: Starting Debugging Tests From the Command Line

li.p: Set some breakpoints in your test code
./gradlew connectedInstrumentTest
In Android Studio, go to Run / Attach Debugger to running process
Wait until you see your test process, since it might take a few seconds
Choose it in the "Choose Process" window (it will look something like this)
Wait until it reaches your breakpoint

doc.h2: Running and Debugging a Single Test From Android Studio
doc.p: These instructions work with either your own application unit tests or the Couchbase lite library code. However, in the case of the latter, you need to depend on the Couchbase Lite code directly rather than using Maven artifacts.

li.p: Go to Run / Edit Configurations.
Click the Plus (+) button and choose Android Tests, and give it a name (for example, MyTest).
In the module pulldown menu, choose the module in which your test lives.

The following figure shows selecting a test in the cblite library.
In the "Test" section, choose the Class radio button.
Under class, add the fully qualified class name that you want to test. For example, com.couchbase.cblite.testapp.tests.Router.
Click Apply or OK
Make sure MyTest is chosen in the configuration pulldown, and choose Run / Debug.
Wait until it reaches your breakpoint.
